A3 Instruction: Serverless Functions

Durham College - SEIT

Ramiyan Gangatharan

100835223

December 13, 2024

Web Development: Frameworks

  • Assignment 1A
  • Assignment 1B
  • Assignment 2A
  • Assignment 2B
  • Assignment 3A
  • Assignment 3B
navigate here

In your site, create a Contact form. Add some appropriate fields (Your Name, Phone Number, E-mail address, Subject, message). Use JavaScript to submit this form via fetch to your serverless function. When you click submit, hide the form, show a spinner. When the response comes back, hide the spinner and show a message, "Thanks for reaching out. We'll get back to you soon!". Create a serverless function that will receive the values from your form, and have it call your mail service to send an email to yourself, and me at adam.kunz+inft@durhamcollege.ca. You should add a prefix to the subject line to denote that this message was sent automatically. I'm going to suggest you also create an alias for the e-mail that goes to you, so you can easily filter them (ie, your.name+some.alias@dc-uoit.ca); Post your site and submit a link to it. I will suggest that you link up with GitHub and deploy it from there- it's a fun and interesting and important exercise- but I won't be looking to see how you did it. I will go to your contact form, fill it out, and expect to get an e-mail a moment later.
